Description: Fragment of wall of Attic red-figured pottery kylix, mended from three sherds, with offset lip. Outside, a school scene: part of a youth wearing a himation around the waist, seated on a cushioned stool, reading a papyrus roll on which are written, stoichedon and boustrophedon, the words στεσιχόρον ὕμνον ἄγοισαι ((the Muses?) bringing in the (e.g. pleasure) of dance-setting songs); behind, bearded figure, probaly leaning on a stick, playing double flute. Inside, part of the maeander band surrounding the tondo and part of an inscription ...os.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Hellenion (Naukratis), Some fragments from the south doorway of Site 64 (Hogarth) (See Hogarth, Lorimer and Edgar 1905, 114)
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
From the same vase as AN1896-1908-G.138.3, 5 and 11.
Bibliographic references: Edgar 1898/1899 / Excavations at Naukratis. B: The Inscribed and Painted Pottery (pp. 64-65, fig. 3)
CVA Oxford I / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum Great Britain Fasc. 3, Oxford Fasc. 1 (pl. 14.28)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.1508)
